intro: Trimezia datensis, commonly known as the datensis trimezia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Cyclanthaceae and is characterized by its unique, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, with lance-shaped leaves and clustered, tubular flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in moist, shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
